description: Machine-readable source of truth for all validation rules. When adding a new rule, add it here AND in VALIDATION-RULES.md. CI parity tests enforce sync.

fix.autofix: boolean - whether this rule has an automatic fix
fix.fix_safety: safe|unsafe|safe/unsafe (only present when autofix is true)

schema.good_example: string - valid config snippet that passes this rule (optional, falls back to category template)
schema.bad_example: string - invalid config snippet that triggers this rule (optional, falls back to category template)

rules.name: Valid Markdown Structure
rules.good_example:
# Project

```python
def hello():
    print("world")
```

See [docs](https://example.com) for more.
rules.bad_example:
# Project

```python
def hello():
    print("world")

This code block is never closed.

rules.name: Missing Section Headers
rules.good_example:
# Main Title

Some content here.

## Section

More content.
rules.bad_example:
Just plain text without any headers.
No structure at all.
Hard to navigate.

rules.name: Character Limit (Windsurf)
rules.good_example:
# Project

Concise agent instructions that stay well under the 12000 character limit.

## Commands

- npm test
- npm build

rules.name: Missing Project Context
rules.good_example:
# Project

This is a web application for task management built with React and Node.js.

## Build Commands

Run npm install and npm build.
rules.bad_example:
# Build Commands

Run npm install and npm build.

## Testing

Use npm test.

rules.name: Platform-Specific Features Without Guard
rules.good_example:
# Project

This project uses various tools.

## Claude Code Specific

- type: PreToolExecution
  command: echo "lint"

context: fork
agent: security-reviewer
rules.bad_example:
# Project

This project uses hooks.

- type: PreToolExecution
  command: echo "test"

context: fork
agent: reviewer
allowed-tools: Read Write

rules.name: Nested AGENTS.md Hierarchy
rules.good_example:
# Project

Single AGENTS.md at the project root with all instructions.

## Commands

- npm test
rules.bad_example:
# Root AGENTS.md

Project instructions.

# src/AGENTS.md (nested, separate file)

Component-specific instructions that create hierarchy ambiguity.

rules.name: Invalid Amp Check Frontmatter
rules.good_example:
---
name: security-review
description: Review security-sensitive changes
severity-default: high
tools:
  - rg
---
# Security Review

Review auth, secrets, and shell execution paths.
rules.bad_example:
---
description: Review security-sensitive changes
unknownKey: true
---
# Security Review

Missing required name field.

rules.name: Invalid Amp severity-default
rules.good_example:
---
name: security-review
severity-default: high
---
# Security Review

Review auth and secret handling.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: security-review
severity-default: urgent
---
# Security Review

Invalid severity-default value.

rules.name: Invalid AGENTS.md globs Frontmatter for Amp
rules.good_example:
---
globs:
  - "src/**/*.rs"
---
# AGENTS

Project instructions for Amp.
rules.bad_example:
---
globs: "[broken"
---
# AGENTS

Invalid glob syntax.

rules.name: Invalid Amp Settings Configuration
Amp Skill Uses Unsupported Field
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-skill
description: A useful development skill
---
# My Skill

Skill instructions here.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-skill
description: A useful development skill
model: opus
---
# My Skill

Skill instructions here.

(Note: AMP-SK-001 requires explicit Amp configuration context. The .agents/ directory is mapped to Codex by default.)

rules.name: Missing Frontmatter
rules.good_example:
---
name: deploy-app
description: Use when deploying the application to production
---
Run the deploy script with the correct environment variables.
rules.bad_example:
No frontmatter here.
Just plain markdown content without YAML delimiters.

rules.name: Missing Required Field: name
rules.good_example:
---
name: lint-code
description: Use when linting the codebase
---
Run eslint on all source files.
rules.bad_example:
---
description: Use when linting the codebase
---
Run eslint on all source files.

rules.name: Missing Required Field: description
rules.good_example:
---
name: lint-code
description: Use when linting the codebase
---
Run eslint on all source files.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: lint-code
---
Run eslint on all source files.

rules.name: Invalid Name Format
rules.good_example:
---
name: run-tests
description: Use when running the test suite
---
Execute all unit tests.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: Run_Tests!
description: Use when running the test suite
---
Execute all unit tests.

rules.name: Name Starts/Ends with Hyphen
rules.good_example:
---
name: build-project
description: Use when building the project
---
Run the build script.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: -build-project-
description: Use when building the project
---
Run the build script.

rules.name: Consecutive Hyphens in Name
rules.good_example:
---
name: format-code
description: Use when formatting source code
---
Run prettier on all files.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: format--code
description: Use when formatting source code
---
Run prettier on all files.

rules.name: Reserved Name
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-helper
description: Use when the user needs help with tasks
---
Provide assistance.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: claude
description: Use when the user needs help with tasks
---
Provide assistance.

rules.name: Description Too Short
rules.good_example:
---
name: check-deps
description: Use when checking project dependencies for updates
---
Run npm outdated.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: check-deps
description: ""
---
Run npm outdated.

rules.name: Description Contains XML
rules.good_example:
---
name: review-pr
description: Use when reviewing a pull request for issues
---
Check the PR for bugs.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: review-pr
description: Use when reviewing a <pull-request> for <issues>
---
Check the PR for bugs.

rules.name: Missing Trigger Phrase
rules.good_example:
---
name: gen-docs
description: Use when generating API documentation from source
---
Run typedoc on the project.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: gen-docs
description: Generates API documentation from source
---
Run typedoc on the project.

rules.name: Compatibility Too Long
rules.good_example:
---
name: migrate-db
description: Use when running database migrations
compatibility: Requires PostgreSQL 14+ and Node.js 18+
---
Run the migration scripts.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: migrate-db
description: Use when running database migrations
compatibility: ""
---
Run the migration scripts.

rules.name: Content Exceeds 500 Lines
rules.good_example:
---
name: setup-env
description: Use when setting up the development environment
---
Install dependencies and configure env vars.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: setup-env
description: Use when setting up the development environment
---
Step 1: Install Node.js
Step 2: Install npm packages
Step 3: Configure database
Step 4: Set environment variables
Step 5: Run migrations
Step 6: Seed data
Step 7: Start server
Step 8: Verify health check
Step 9: Run smoke tests
Step 10: Done
(imagine this continues for 500+ lines)

rules.name: File Reference Too Deep
rules.good_example:
---
name: read-config
description: Use when reading project configuration
---
See references/config.md for details.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: read-config
description: Use when reading project configuration
---
See references/deep/nested/config.md for details.

rules.name: Windows Path Separator
rules.good_example:
---
name: check-paths
description: Use when validating file paths
---
Check src/utils/helper.ts for the implementation.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: check-paths
description: Use when validating file paths
---
Check src\utils\helper.ts for the implementation.

rules.name: Upload Size Exceeds 8MB
rules.good_example:
---
name: small-skill
description: Use when running a lightweight task
---
This skill directory is under 8MB total.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: huge-skill
description: Use when running a task with many large assets
---
This skill bundles 10MB of binary data in its directory.

rules.name: Skill Parse Error
rules.good_example:
---
name: valid-yaml
description: Use when demonstrating valid YAML frontmatter
---
Body content here.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: broken-yaml
description: [unclosed bracket
---
Body content here.

rules.name: Name Must Match Parent Directory
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-review
description: Use when reviewing pull requests
---
Review changed files and report findings.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: deploy-helper
description: Use when validating deployment checks
---
This file is stored in code-review/SKILL.md.

rules.name: Description Uses First or Second Person
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-review
description: Use when reviewing pull requests for defects
---
Review code and summarize critical findings.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: code-review
description: You can use this skill when reviewing pull requests
---
Review code and summarize critical findings.

rules.name: Vague Skill Name
rules.good_example:
---
name: postgres-query-planner
description: Use when optimizing PostgreSQL queries
---
Analyze query plans and suggest improvements.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: helper
description: Use when handling tasks
---
Execute helper routines.

rules.name: Missing Name Field
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews pull requests for quality
---
Review code changes and provide feedback.
rules.bad_example:
---
description: Reviews pull requests for quality
---
Review code changes and provide feedback.

rules.name: Missing Description Field
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews pull requests for quality
---
Review code changes and provide feedback.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
---
Review code changes and provide feedback.

rules.name: Invalid Model Value
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
model: sonnet
---
Review code changes.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
model: gpt-4
---
Review code changes.

rules.name: Invalid Permission Mode
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
permissionMode: acceptEdits
---
Review code changes.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
permissionMode: yolo
---
Review code changes.

rules.name: Referenced Skill Not Found
rules.good_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
skills:
  - code-review
---
Review code changes.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: code-reviewer
description: Reviews code
skills:
  - nonexistent-skill
---
Review code changes.

rules.name: Tool/Disallowed Conflict
rules.good_example:
---
name: safe-agent
description: Agent with separate tool lists
tools:
  - Read
  - Grep
disallowedTools:
  - Bash
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: conflict-agent
description: Agent with conflicting tool lists
tools:
  - Read
  - Bash
disallowedTools:
  - Bash
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Agent Parse Error
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: A working agent
---
Agent instructions here.
rules.bad_example:
name: my-agent
description: Missing the --- delimiters

Agent instructions here.

rules.name: Invalid Memory Scope
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with valid memory
memory: project
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with invalid memory
memory: global
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Invalid Tool Name in Tools List
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with valid tools
tools:
  - Read
  - Write
  - Bash
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with unknown tool
tools:
  - Read
  - MakeFile
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Invalid Tool Name in DisallowedTools
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with valid disallowed tools
disallowedTools:
  - Bash
  - WebFetch
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with unknown disallowed tool
disallowedTools:
  - Bash
  - RunCode
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Invalid Hooks in Agent Frontmatter
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with valid hooks
hooks:
  PreToolUse:
    - matcher: Bash
      hooks:
        - type: command
          command: echo ok
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with invalid hooks
hooks:
  InvalidEvent:
    - matcher: Bash
      hooks:
        - type: command
          command: echo ok
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Bypass Permissions Warning
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with safe permissions
permissionMode: default
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with dangerous permissions
permissionMode: bypassPermissions
---
Agent instructions.

rules.name: Invalid Skill Name Format
rules.good_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with valid skill names
skills:
  - code-review
  - deploy-prod
---
Agent instructions.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: my-agent
description: Agent with invalid skill name format
skills:
  - Code_Review
  - --bad-name
---
Agent instructions.

Matcher on Non-Tool Event
Missing Type Field
Missing Command Field
Missing Prompt Field
Script File Not Found
Dangerous Command Pattern
Timeout Policy
Invalid Timeout Value
Hooks Parse Error
Async on Non-Command Hook
Once Outside Skill/Agent Frontmatter
Model on Command Hook
Validate Hook Type Agent

Matcher on UserPromptSubmit/Stop

rules.good_example:
# Project Memory

Always run tests before committing.
Follow the coding standards in the docs/ directory.
rules.bad_example:
# Project Memory

See @docs/nonexistent-guide.md for the coding standards.

Always run tests before committing.

rules.name: Circular Import
Import Depth Exceeds 5
Invalid Command Reference
rules.good_example:
# Commands

Run tests with `npm run test`
Build with `npm run build`

(Valid when package.json has test and build scripts)
rules.bad_example:
# Commands

Run tests with `npm run nonexistent`

(Requires package.json with scripts section in the same directory for this rule to trigger)

rules.name: Generic Instruction
rules.good_example:
# Project Rules

Always use TypeScript strict mode.
Run `cargo test` before committing.
rules.bad_example:
Be helpful and accurate when responding.
Always provide the best possible answer.

rules.name: Negative Without Positive
rules.good_example:
# Rules

Never use var in JavaScript, instead prefer const or let.
rules.bad_example:
# Rules

Never use var in JavaScript.

rules.name: Weak Constraint Language
rules.good_example:
# Critical Rules

You must follow the coding style guide.
rules.bad_example:
# Critical Rules

You should follow the coding style guide.

rules.name: Critical Content in Middle
rules.good_example:
# Critical Rules

IMPORTANT: Always run tests before committing.

## Setup

Install dependencies with npm install.

## Architecture

The project uses a monorepo structure.

## Testing

Run unit tests.

## Deployment

Deploy to staging.

## Monitoring

Check dashboards.

## Cleanup

Remove temp files.
rules.bad_example:
## Setup

Install dependencies with npm install.

## Architecture

The project uses a monorepo structure.

## Testing

Run unit tests with npm test.

IMPORTANT: Always run tests before committing.

## Deployment

Deploy to staging first.

## Monitoring

Check dashboards after deploy.

## Cleanup

Remove temp files after build.

rules.name: README Duplication
rules.good_example:
# Project Memory

Project-specific agent instructions:
- Always run tests before committing
- Use feature branches for changes
rules.bad_example:
# My Project

This project validates agent configurations using Rust for performance.

(Content duplicated verbatim from README.md)

rules.name: Invalid Paths Glob in Rules
rules.good_example:
---
paths:
  - "src/**/*.ts"
  - "lib/**/*.js"
---
# TypeScript Guidelines

Always use strict mode.
rules.bad_example:
---
paths:
  - "[unclosed"
---
# TypeScript Guidelines

Always use strict mode.

rules.name: Rules File Unknown Frontmatter Key
rules.good_example:
---
paths:
  - "src/**/*.ts"
---
# TypeScript Guidelines

Always use strict mode.
rules.bad_example:
---
paths:
  - "src/**/*.ts"
description: "some rule"
alwaysApply: true
---
# TypeScript Guidelines

Always use strict mode.

rules.name: Plugin Manifest Not in .claude-plugin/
Components in .claude-plugin/
Invalid Semver
Missing Required/Recommended Plugin Field
Empty Plugin Name
Plugin Parse Error
rules.bad_example: { name: my-plugin, version: 1.0.0 }

rules.name: Invalid Component Path
Component Inside .claude-plugin
Invalid Author Object
Invalid Homepage URL
Invalid Model Value
rules.good_example:
---
name: fast-review
description: Use when doing quick code reviews
model: haiku
---
Review the code for obvious issues.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: fast-review
description: Use when doing quick code reviews
model: gpt-4
---
Review the code for obvious issues.

rules.name: Invalid Context Value
rules.good_example:
---
name: parallel-task
description: Use when running tasks in parallel
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
---
Run the task in a forked context.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: parallel-task
description: Use when running tasks in parallel
context: spawn
agent: general-purpose
---
Run the task in a spawned context.

rules.name: Context Without Agent
rules.good_example:
---
name: sub-task
description: Use when delegating work to a sub-agent
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
---
Delegate the task to a sub-agent.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: sub-task
description: Use when delegating work to a sub-agent
context: fork
---
Delegate the task to a sub-agent.

rules.name: Agent Without Context
rules.good_example:
---
name: explore-code
description: Use when exploring the codebase
context: fork
agent: Explore
---
Explore the codebase structure.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: explore-code
description: Use when exploring the codebase
agent: Explore
---
Explore the codebase structure.

rules.name: Invalid Agent Type
rules.good_example:
---
name: search-files
description: Use when searching for files in the project
context: fork
agent: Explore
---
Search the project for relevant files.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: search-files
description: Use when searching for files in the project
context: fork
agent: Invalid Agent!!
---
Search the project for relevant files.

rules.name: Dangerous Auto-Invocation
rules.good_example:
---
name: deploy-staging
description: Use when deploying to staging environment
disable-model-invocation: true
---
Deploy the application to staging.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: deploy-staging
description: Use when deploying to staging environment
---
Deploy the application to staging.

rules.name: Unrestricted Bash
rules.good_example:
---
name: git-status
description: Use when checking git status
allowed-tools: Bash(git:*), Read
---
Run git status and read the output.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: git-status
description: Use when checking git status
allowed-tools: Bash, Read
---
Run git status and read the output.

rules.name: Unknown Tool Name
rules.good_example:
---
name: find-files
description: Use when finding files by pattern
allowed-tools: Glob, Grep, Read
---
Search for files matching the pattern.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: find-files
description: Use when finding files by pattern
allowed-tools: Glob, Grep, FooBar
---
Search for files matching the pattern.

rules.name: Too Many Injections
rules.good_example:
---
name: template-skill
description: Use when applying a code template
---
Apply the template with !`config.json` values.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: template-skill
description: Use when applying a code template
---
Use !`config.json` and !`env.json` and !`secrets.json` and !`overrides.json` for setup.

rules.name: Invalid Hooks in Skill Frontmatter
rules.good_example:
---
name: hook-skill
description: Use when running a skill with hooks
hooks:
  PreToolUse:
    - type: command
      command: echo pre
---
Run with hooks.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: hook-skill
description: Use when running a skill with hooks
hooks:
  InvalidEvent:
    - type: command
      command: echo bad
---
Run with hooks.

rules.name: Unreachable Skill
rules.good_example:
---
name: internal-skill
description: Use when running internal automation
user-invocable: false
---
This skill can still be invoked by the model.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: internal-skill
description: Use when running internal automation
user-invocable: false
disable-model-invocation: true
---
This skill cannot be reached by anyone.

rules.name: Argument Hint Without $ARGUMENTS
rules.good_example:
---
name: greet-user
description: Use when greeting a user by name
argument-hint: Enter the user's name
---
Greet the user: Hello, $ARGUMENTS!
rules.bad_example:
---
name: greet-user
description: Use when greeting a user by name
argument-hint: Enter the user's name
---
Greet the user with a friendly message.

rules.name: Fork Context Without Actionable Instructions
rules.good_example:
---
name: analyze-code
description: Use when analyzing code quality
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
---
Run static analysis on the codebase and report findings.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: analyze-code
description: Use when analyzing code quality
context: fork
agent: general-purpose
---
This is some informational text without any actionable verbs.

rules.name: Invalid disable-model-invocation Type
rules.good_example:
---
name: quiet-skill
description: Use when running without model invocation
disable-model-invocation: true
---
Run silently.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: quiet-skill
description: Use when running without model invocation
disable-model-invocation: "true"
---
Run silently.

rules.name: Invalid user-invocable Type
rules.good_example:
---
name: slash-cmd
description: Use when user types the slash command
user-invocable: true
---
Handle the slash command.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: slash-cmd
description: Use when user types the slash command
user-invocable: "false"
---
Handle the slash command.

rules.name: Indexed $ARGUMENTS Without argument-hint
rules.good_example:
---
name: run-check
description: Use when validating a provided path
argument-hint: path-to-target
---
Run checks against $ARGUMENTS[0].
rules.bad_example:
---
name: run-check
description: Use when validating a provided path
---
Run checks against $ARGUMENTS[0].

rules.name: Unknown Frontmatter Field
rules.good_example:
---
name: lint-config
description: Use when validating configuration files
allowed-tools: Read, Grep
---
Lint project configuration files.
rules.bad_example:
---
name: lint-config
description: Use when validating configuration files
allowed_tools: Read, Grep
---
Lint project configuration files.

rules.name: Negative-Only Instructions
